entry.title: Movie: Spider-Man (2002)
entry.content:
Movie: Spider-Man (2002)20130709
I remember really loving this movie when it came out, but when I
watched it again, I felt that the effects and costumes were really
ugly. My wife said that the Green Goblin looked like a Power
Rangers character. I like that the new series is more true to the
source material. I also found that some of the scenes in this movie
moved too fast and were too gimmicky, like when Aunt May is
attacked.
  • Movies
  • 2002

entry.title: Game: Castlevania: Symphony of the Night (PS1, 1997) (8)
entry.content:
Game: Castlevania: Symphony of the Night (PS1, 1997) (8)20130707
I'm back at my parents' house, so I finished that game today in
about two hours. I used the Shield Rod + Alucard Shield a lot and
just creamed everything. My final stats were: level 46, 6:34:32 on
the clock and 195.1% completion.

Game 3:  8:00 [Alucard at parents] [DONE]
Game 6:  0:50 [Richter at summer house]
Total time: 15:52
  • Video Games
  • Castlevania: Symphony of the Night
  • PS1
  • 1997

entry.title: Game: Nintendo Land (WiiU, 2012)
entry.content:
Game: Nintendo Land (WiiU, 2012)20130707
My parents got a Wii U and we played a few games together on
vacation. I found the games (Mario Chase and Ghost Mansion) pretty
fun, but found that they lost their appeal much more quickly than
Wii Sports games. Since they are much more competitive, directly
as opposed to by score, it was easy to find a dominating strategy
and then just milk it. I felt like the games each had an optimum
number of players for fun, even though they allow any number. This
experience downgraded it from "Want to buy when I get a Wii U" to
"Can ignore".
  • Video Games
  • Nintendo Land
  • WiiU
  • 2012

entry.title: Game: Castlevania: Symphony of the Night (PS1, 1997) (7)
entry.content:
Game: Castlevania: Symphony of the Night (PS1, 1997) (7)20130706
I beat the game again this morning after about an hour. It was a
pretty rough fight using the Alucard Sword (rather than something
cheesy), but it felt good. My ending stats were: level 44, 5:05:11
on the game clock, and 191.6% completion.

My son immediately wanted to see Richter, so later in the day I
played for about an hour and got to just before the Royal Chapel
with 33.8% in 0:34:42 on the clock. I won't go back to that PS2
for at least a year though, so it will be a done game.

Game 3:  5:44 [Alucard at parents]
Game 5:  6:28 [Alucard at summer house] [DONE]
Game 6:  0:50 [Richter at summer house]
Total time: 13:36
  • Video Games
  • Castlevania: Symphony of the Night
  • PS1
  • 1997

entry.title: Movie: Live Free or Die Hard, starring Bruce Willis (2007)
entry.content:
Movie: Live Free or Die Hard, starring Bruce Willis (2007)20130706
I saw this movie in the theatres and thought it was amazing. On a
second viewing, it was still awesome. I really like the John
McClane character and his daughter in the movie is awesome. There
are so many choice quotes and moments in this movie, but if I had
to isolate what I like it's the over-the-top-ness and the way
McClane just stumbles into the action.
  • Movies
  • 2007

entry.title: Game: Shadow of the Colossus (PS2, 2005) (3)
entry.content:
Game: Shadow of the Colossus (PS2, 2005) (3)20130705
I took an attempt at the ninth colossi over an hour. Man, it was
painful. I could tell pretty quickly what I was supposed to do:
get it to walk over the geyser, shoot its feet, and then climb on
it. In the hour I played, I got him to go over the geyser maybe 4
times and only got to climb on it twice, and never actually got on
its back. It was so painful and it made me not want to play the
game anymore.

Overall, I really like the feel of this game, but I find it too
frustrating. This boss is a great example of why: the game is very
committed to creating a "real" world with "real" beasts that you
have to take down. This commitment to reality is inspiring and
pretty neat, but it can cause great annoyances: a very long trip
to every boss fight, waiting while the animals swim or fly around
in great circles, etc. I feel like they should've been programmed
to "cooperate" more with the player's goals.

Given my scarce time, particularly at the place where I played it,
it wasn't worth fighting through.

Total time: 5:04
  • Video Games
  • Shadow of the Colossus
  • PS2
  • 2005

entry.title: Game: Castlevania: Symphony of the Night (PS1, 1997) (5)
entry.content:
Game: Castlevania: Symphony of the Night (PS1, 1997) (5)20130704
As I said yesterday, my kids really love this game, so I started
another game from the start. Hopefully this will allow to play as
Richter at this place in the future. After forty minutes, I was
able to have the Jewel of Open and readying myself to go through
the Chapel. Later in the day I played for another hour or so and
got all the movement abilities and was ready to go through the
Clock Tower (I race through as Mist) and then to the Underground
to close up the normal castle.

Game 3: 5:44
Game 5: 1:57
Total time: 8:15
  • Video Games
  • Castlevania: Symphony of the Night
  • PS1
  • 1997

entry.title: Game: Shadow of the Colossus (PS2, 2005) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Shadow of the Colossus (PS2, 2005) (2)20130704
After about an hour, I got three more Colossi. The bird, sea
serpent, and lightning lobster/turtle were much more difficult and
tricky to fight. I was annoyed traveling to fight them though,
because I felt like I was going in circles. I do like this game
though... I don't find the story and setting that interesting
though. Just the gameplay.

Total time: 4:14
  • Video Games
  • Shadow of the Colossus
  • PS2
  • 2005

entry.title: Movie: Die Hard with a Vengeance, starring Bruce Willis (1995)
entry.content:
Movie: Die Hard with a Vengeance, starring Bruce Willis (1995)20130704
This was always my favourite Die Hard and it did not disappoint
this time. The thing I love about it is the deviousness of the
villain. It's very cool. I thought the ending was a bit lame,
almost like there could have been a lot more to flesh it out or the
ending was originally supposed to have the bad guys win. In any
case, the movie was still great although it had a /lot/ of
swearing.
  • Movies
  • 1995

entry.title: Game: Castlevania: Symphony of the Night (PS1, 1997) (4)
entry.content:
Game: Castlevania: Symphony of the Night (PS1, 1997) (4)20130703
I played today for an hour and half and got to the inverted
castle. I got about 30% through it. I need to explore the middle
and underside of the castle to continue.

Later in the day, I went to a different place and my kids wanted
to watch me play again. I didn't want to immediately start another
game, so I decided to play as Richter. But I forgot that I needed
to have a clear save, so I failed.

entry.title: Game: Shadow of the Colossus (PS2, 2005)
entry.content:
Game: Shadow of the Colossus (PS2, 2005)20130703
I played today for about three hours. I've heard this game talked
about for a long time. I found the mechanics to be satisfying and
not very awkward after you got to the first one. I really enjoy
climbing up and taking down the Colossi. Even after four or five
though it felt a little routine.

Total time: 2:57
